subject: Politics
title: Failed States
description: A micro-lesson that makes Failed States usable.

hook.text: Somalia had no functioning government for 20 years. When states fail, warlords and extremists fill the gap.

buildup.text: Failed states can't provide security, services, or rule of law. They collapse into chaos and violence.

discovery.text: Afghanistan, Yemen, and Libya are among the world's most fragile states. Their instability spills across borders.

twist.text: Failed states export problems: terrorism, refugees, and drug trafficking. One failed state threatens an entire region.

climax.text: Fixing failed states costs far more than preventing failure. But prevention rarely gets funding or attention.

punchline.text: States fail slowly, then all at once. Prevention is cheap; rebuilding is not.

quiz.question: What problems do failed states export to neighboring regions?
